name: Lost for Words! 23 Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"Oh! ______, I am but a fool
Darling I love you, though you treat me cruel
You hurt me, and you made me cry 
But if you leave me, I will surely die."

What is the name of the girl at whom this refrain is directed?
questions.explanation:
Carol.

	"Oh! Carol" was a hit for Neil Sedaka in 1959. Neil penned this song with his long time writing partner Howard Greenfield. "Oh! Carol" peaked at #3 in the UK singles chart.

questions.text:
"First when there's nothing 
But a slow glowing dream 
That your fear seems to hide 
______ inside your mind."

Irene Cara sang the lyric, but which word is missing?
questions.explanation:
deep.

	Irene Cara hit the charts with "Flashdance... What A Feeling" in 1983."Flashdance" featured in the film of the same name. It was US chart topper, peaking at #2 in the UK.

questions.text:
"Oh yeah I tell you somethin'
I think you'll understand
When I say that somethin'
I want to hold your ______"

So what are the singers asking to hold on to in this song?
questions.explanation:
hand.

	These lyrics come from the Beatles song "I Want To Hold Your Hand".This song, written by John Lennon and Paul McCartney, topped the charts on both sides of the Atlantic.

questions.text:
"I rode my ______ past your window last night
I roller-skated to your door at daylight
It almost seems like you're avoiding me
I'm okay alone, but you got something I need."

What form of transport is missing from this lyric?
questions.explanation:
bicycle.

	Melanie, full name Melanie Safka, had success with these lyrics from "Brand New Key" in 1971/2.A US #1, the song peaked at #4 in the UK.

questions.text:
"When no-one else can understand me 
When everything I do is wrong 
You give me hope and ______ 
You give me strength to carry on."

What does this wonderful person give to inspire the singer?
questions.explanation:
consolation.

	These lyrics come from Elvis "The King" Presley's hit "The Wonder Of You".This Baker Knight composition charted no less than three times in the UK, topping the chart in 1970 and re-entering in 1971 and 1977.

questions.text:
"______ around 
Every now and then I get a little bit tired 
of listening to the sound of my tears
______ around."

What word is missing from this power ballad sung by Bonnie Tyler?
questions.explanation:
Turn.

	"Total Eclipse Of The Heart" topped the charts for Bonnie Tyler in 1983.This dramatic ballad, written by Jim Steinman, was the first single by a Welsh artist to top the US charts.Bonnie was born Gaynor Hopkins in Swansea in 1953.

questions.text:
"Karma, karma, karma, karma, karma chameleon 
You come and go, you come and go 
Loving would be easy if your colours were like my dream 
Red _____ and green, red ______ and green." 

What colour completes the dream sequence?
questions.explanation:
gold.

	Culture Club made a splash with these lyrics from "Karma Chameleon" in 1983.The group fronted by Boy George, real name George O'Dowd, topped the US and UK singles charts with this UK million seller.

questions.text:
"Just walking in the ______
So alone and blue 
All because my heart still remembers you."

So, where was this wistful singer walking?
questions.explanation:
rain.

	Johnnie Ray charted with "Just Walking In The Rain" in 1956. This UK chart topper, US #3, was produced by Mitch Miller.Johnnie earned the name "The Cry Guy" for his tear jerking rendition of the songs "Cry" and "The Little White Cloud that Cried". Johnnie Ray died in 1990.

questions.text:
"Ten, twenty, thirty, forty, fifty or more 
The Bloody ______ Baron was rollin' out the score 
Eighty men died tryin' to end that spree 
Of the Bloody ______ Baron of Germany."

What colour completes the lyric?
questions.explanation:
Red.

	These lyrics come from "Snoopy Versus The Red Baron", a novelty hit for US group The Royal Guardsmen in 1966/7.

questions.text:
"Ev'ry mornin' at the mine you could see him arrive 
He stood six foot six and weighed two forty five 
Kind'a broad at the shoulder and narrow at the hip 
And everybody knew ya didn't give no lip to Big ______."

What is the big guy's name?
questions.explanation:
John.

	"Big Bad John" was a massive hit for Jimmy Dean in 1961.This tale of a mining disaster was a chart topper on both sides of the Atlantic.
